hero.title: Dandan Zhang
hero.description: I am a Lecturer (US equivalent: Assistant Professor) in Medical Robotics in the Department of Bioengineering and a Lecturer in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in the I-X initiative at Imperial College London. I am the Director of the Multi-Scale Embodied Intelligence Laboratory. I have been an honorary researcher in the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering at Imperial College London. Before joining Imperial, I was a Lecturer in the Department of Engineering Mathematics at the University of Bristol, affiliated with the Bristol Robotics Laboratory. I earned her Ph.D. degree from the Department of Computing and her MRes degree from the Department of Surgery and Cancer at Imperial College London. I have cross-disciplinary interests in robotics, biomedicine, and AI. Overall, we have published more than 70 papers in top-tier peer-reviewed engineering and medical imaging journals and conference proceedings.

data.title: Multimodal Perception (Sensing)
data.intro: We design novel deep learning, reinforcement learning, and federated learning algorithms for robust, scalable, and privacy-preserving AI.
data.description: Developing novel algorithms and architectures for deep learning, reinforcement learning, and federated learning.

data.title: Interactive Learning (Decision-Making)
data.intro: Our work in computer vision covers object detection, segmentation, and multimodal learning, with a focus on medical imaging and real-world visual understanding.
data.description: Advancing visual understanding through object detection, image segmentation, and multimodal learning.

data.title: Dexterous ManipulationÔºàExecution)
data.intro: We build intelligent language models and systems for text understanding, generation, and cross-modal AI, enabling machines to process and reason with human language.
data.description: Building intelligent language models and systems for text understanding and generation.

opening.description:
I am looking for highly motivated PhD students to work on microfluidics for microrobotics at Imperial College London. Prospective students will have a good first degree in Bioengineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Automation or other engineering-related disciplines. Please feel free to drop me an email if you are interested.
For details, please check the Vacancies page.

data.summary: We will organise the 1st Trustworthy Embodied Intelligence in Healthcare International Symposium at Imperial College, White City campus on 17th July.
One paper on patch clamp multi-pipette localisation accepted at IROS‚Äô2025.

We will organise the 2nd MEIS Workshop at CVPR2025.
One paper accepted by the Cyborg and Bionic Systems.
Dr. Zhang was shortlisted for AI Visionaries 2025.

lists: 2022 UK Best PhD in Robotics Award
